feed.title: SAP Community - SAP Business One
feed.subtitle: SAP Business One Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: SAP Business One for HANA Client Hangs Permanently on Loading Screen After Successful Credentials
entry.content:
1. System Environment

  • SAP B1 Version:

    SAP B1 10.0 VERSION for HANA & PL 02

  • Database: SAP HANA

    SAP HANA Enterprise Edition 2.0 SPS04 Rev 45 for B1

  • Deployment:

    On-Premise

2. Problem Description

After the user successfully enters credentials and selects the company database in the SAP Business One client, the client window opens but gets permanently stuck on the loading screen. The main application menu never appears.

  • No specific error message or timeout occurs; the process hangs indefinitely.

  • This issue affects all users and all client machines.

3. Steps to Reproduce

  1. Launch the SAP Business One client.

  2. Enter credentials and select the Company Database.

  3. Click OK.

  4. The application window opens and hangs on the loading screen indefinitely.

4. Detailed Troubleshooting Performed

We have executed the following checks, ruling out core database and server issues:

  • HANA Database Status: Verified that all core SAP HANA services (Indexserver, Nameserver, Daemon, etc.) are running and active (Green status). The relevant screenshot from the HANA Cockpit/Studio is attached.

  • B1 Service Health: Confirmed the License Manager Service, SLD Service, and B1iF/Service Layer are all running and restarted.

  • Server Load: Confirmed there is no unusual CPU or Memory utilization on either the HANA or B1 Application Server during the hang.

  • Add-On Bypass: We attempted to log in using the CTRL + SHIFT method to bypass Add-On initialization; the issue persists.

  • User/Role Check: The hang occurs for all users, including the B1 Superuser.

5. Conclusion & Request

The hang is likely occurring at the application layer during the B1 License validation, Cockpit loading, or interaction with an internal B1 service.

We require immediate support to resolve this issue.

Thank you for your urgent attention on this matter.

Best regards,

Sunil Patil

entry.title: SAP Business One Mobile App Login Failing After Upgrade to FP 2405 (Processing Failed Error)
entry.content:
We are experiencing a critical issue with the SAP Business One Mobile Application, where all users are unable to log in on both Android and iOS.
The mobile app version currently in use is 1.2.18.

Error Message (Mobile App)

“Processing Failed. Internal Server Error. Contact your system administrator.”

System Landscape

  • SAP Business One 10.0 for SAP HANA
    Version: 10.00.250 – FP 2405 (64-bit)
  • Integration Framework (B1iF) version 1.22.57
  • Deployment: On-premise, physical server located at the customer site

The mobility setup was fully working before the upgrade from version 2105 → FP 2405.
The issue only started immediately after the upgrade.

Configuration Details

  1. SLD Configuration

B1i Server

  • Company Database: B1DI and JDBC connections configured
  • All connectivity tests successful

wsformobile

  • WSAN, WSAS, WSAR configured with correct associated server IP
  • Using port 8080
  • destHost configured correctly
  • All connectivity tests successful

B1IA Server

  • HTTA and HTTP (associated server IP) configured
  • Connectivity tests successful

B1IADB

  • JDBC connectivity configured
  • Connectivity tests successful
  1. Scenario Configuration
  • sapb1mobile scenario is fully configured
  • Scenario package activated
  • All scenario steps and tasks are running without errors
  1. User & License Setup
  • Mobility users created correctly
  • License assignments completed
  • Device IDs generated and assigned
  • Mobile configuration on the SAP B1 application side appears correct
  1. Connectivity Status
  • SAP B1 Application ↔ Integration Framework connectivity via destHost over port 8080 is successful
  • Integration Framework is reachable internally and externally
  • However, mobile login still fails with the same “Processing Failed” error
  1. Certificates
  • A self-signed certificate was generated correctly
  • Imported and applied according to SAP guidelines
  • No certificate trust warnings on either Android or iOS
  1. Integration Framework Troubleshooting Tool

Manual tests performed on:

  • B1 Mobile (iOS)
  • B1 Mobile (Android)

All tests passed successfully:

  • Connectivity
  • Authentication
  • Certificate validation
  • Service availability
  • Endpoint checks

No errors were reported.

SAP Notes Already Followed

We have already completed all troubleshooting steps from the following SAP Notes:

  • 1924930 – SAP Business One Mobile App for Android
  • 1602674 – SAP Business One Mobile App for iOS

Including:

  • Endpoint validation
  • Reverse proxy checks
  • Certificate validation
  • Testing URLs directly in browser
  • Checking mobile service HTTP responses
  • Reviewing B1i logs and mobile service logs

All checks passed successfully.

Current Situation

Despite:

  • ✔ Correct SLD setup
  • ✔ Successful B1iF connectivity
  • ✔ Scenario package activated and running
  • ✔ Integration tests successful (iOS + Android)
  • ✔ Certificate setup validated

The mobile app still cannot authenticate and always returns the “Processing Failed. Internal Server Error” message.

Has anyone experienced a similar issue after upgrading to SAP Business One FP 2405 where the Mobile App login fails although all B1iF configurations and tests are successful?

We are  looking for insights regarding:

  • Additional configuration steps required for FP 2405
  • Known issues or patches related to mobile services after upgrading
  • Changes in mobile endpoints or certificates introduced in 2405
  • Required B1iF updates or notes specific to mobile scenarios
  • Any logs or components we may have overlooked

Any guidance, recommendations, or related SAP Notes would be highly appreciated.

entry.title: Internal Error 5002 occurred when adding sales delivery
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

For a specific item and batch, when adding sales delivery, it throws error Internal Error 5002 occurred when copying from Picklist or Sales Order. This is random and it works for some cases. For rest of Item and Batches there are no errors noticed.

There is stock for that Item-Batch and is allocated to Sales Order prior to creating Delivery.

Can experts guide to troubleshoot this please.

Thanks in advance.

entry.title: Inquiry on SAP B1 DB Audit Data (DML History, Change/Access Logs, Authorization Tables)
entry.content:
One of B1 partner sent the below questions from the customer. 

I would appreciate it if you could review and provide the answers.

*If certain items are not provided, please let me know. If they are available, please provide the relevant information along with the database tables where we can verify them.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

1. Inquiry Regarding DB DML Change History (Data Modification Log)

We need to verify whether any data modification (DML) occurred in the SAP B1 database during a specific period.

Is there a method to query DB-level data change history (DML logs) within the SAP B1 database?

 

2. Inquiry Regarding Access Log / Change Log / Authorization Log Tables and SQL Queries

We would like to identify which database tables store the Access Logs, Change Logs, and Authorization Logs provided by SAP Business One.

 

2-1. Change Log – Difference View

In Administration → Setup → General → Users, after selecting a user, the toolbar provides a “Change Log – Show Differences” view.

We would like to retrieve the same information directly from the database.

Please provide the table name(s) and SQL query to extract these change-difference details.

 

2-2. Access Log

In Administration → Setup → General → Users, after selecting a user, the toolbar provides an “Access Log” view.

We would like to extract the same access log information directly from the database.

Please provide the related table name(s) and SQL query.

 

2-3. General Authorization Data

In Administration → System Initialization → Authorizations → General Authorizations, we would like to extract the full authorization data for all users directly from the database.

Please provide the related table name(s) and SQL query.

 

Thank you!

entry.title: Unable to Add In-Memory Application Platform BD 2.0 Despite Removing Previous Installations
entry.content:
We are facing an issue while trying to add the In-Memory Application Platform BD 2.0 for one of our clients. Despite deleting all previous installations, we are still unable to add or install BD 2.0. 

Please find below details:

1. Attempting to add/activate: In-Memory Application Platform BD 2.0

2. All previous related installations have already been removed

3. System still does not allow us to add BD 2.0

4. There should be 1 active license must be shown

5. No specific error message shown.

Could anyone guide us on the steps required to successfully add BD 2.0, or advise if there are any prerequisites, clean up procedures, or system checks that we may have missed?

entry.title: Item has incorrect Last Purchase Price of zero
entry.content:
Hi,

We have an inventory item that has only two GRPOs, both of which have positive quantities and a price determined. No other transactions of any kind, that should affect the Last Purchase Price, exist; no A/P Invoices, no Goods Returns, no A/P Credit memos, no landed costs, no freight, no production. The item is no a BOM, nor is it a component of a BOM.

The price before and after discount in both GRPOs is 0.28 €, but the Last Purchase Price is zero, both in the LPP pricelist and in the OITM table.

It is an inventory item, G/L accounts set by warehouse, Manage Inventory By Warehouse is set, valuation method is Moving Average (the Cost Price / Moving Average price in the warehouse is also 0.28 €). SAP Business One 10.0 (10.00.180) FP 2111 (64-bit).

What could explain this? Is there anything I could check?

Regards,

Johan

entry.content:

Would anyone help me.

Thanks in advance.

entry.title: Import Fixed Assets: Depreciation amount is incorrect
entry.content:
Hello folks,

I noticed the depreciation amount is incorrect after I excecuted an import.

10% of 109,055 is 10,905.5 but it says 10,905.21.  It's a very small amount but it's a pain if it happens everywhere.  Does anyone know the rationale of the calculation?

I appreciate your help in advance.

Regards,

Koichi

entry.title: Fixed Assets: Capitalization doesn't work
entry.content:
Hello folks,

I understand the flow of fixed asstets is as follows:

  1. Make an Asset Master Data
  2. Make an AP Invoice and include the fixed asset above as an item
  3. Capitalization opens up automatically when I add the AP Invoice above

But the capitalization windown doesn't open up and, because of that, the depreciation that should associate this item doesn't get generated.

Does anyone have the same problem?  One thing is that it worked before.  And then we enabled Data Ownership in the General Settings.  I'm not sure if it relates to this problem at all though.

I appreciate your help in advance.

Regards,

Koichi

entry.title: P&L differ from balance sheet
entry.content:
Hello, appreciate if someone can help to point out how I can solve the mistamtach: my P/L result as at 30.11.25 is -708,326.00, profit period calculated in the Balance sheet is -707,905.69. After analysis, I realized that the different of are due to 3 transactions:

  1. SGD258.66 Under COGS: 51010110 - COGS (INGENIUM) G/L code created was created, but it was not mapped to P&L in Oct’25, during this period, first transaction posted Journal: DR COGS 258.66 CR Inventory 258.66. But P&L match to balance sheet profit/loss period. In November, I mapped COGS to P&L. The P&L and balance sheet mismatch by this exact amount: SGD258.66

  2. SGD 156.00: JE 2025000087: Forex adjustment to align GST Control (SGD) w Tax Report 2nd quarter.

DR

GST CONTROL - AUST

           156.00

 

CR

EXCHANGE GAIN OR LOSS - REALISED

 

              156.00

 

  1. SGD5.24 due to some entries to reserve out GST AUS input and placed into Telephone expenses bill

Document

Title

DR (AUD)

 CR (AUD) 

DR (SGD)

 CR (SGD) 

CN 2025010

Standalone CN to credit out GST Input of non claimable bill (reduce)

 

   Vendor 

6.29

 

                  5.24

 

 

     Gst input (AUD)

 

               6.29

 

               5.24

IP 2026053

Incoming Payment to clear CN balance and as internal bridging adjustment nets zero, prepares for P&L reclass

 

  Contra

6.29

 

                  5.24

 

 

     Vendor 

 

               6.29

 

               5.24

JE 2025000086

Contra Clearing, reclass GST to Telephone expense (SGD) account

 

  Telephone expense

 

 

                  5.24

 

 

     Contra 

 

 

 

               5.24

 
The last 2 transactions are link to GST Aus input/control account as we file for GST in Australia as well. Our local currency is SGD
 
Thanks in advance

entry.title: How to differentiate UDO/UDF/UDT created via SDK (DI API) and created via UI in SAP Business One?
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I am currently working with SAP Business One and need to determine whether the existing User-Defined Objects (UDO), User-Defined Fields (UDF), and User-Defined Tables (UDT) in the system were created using the SDK (DI API) or through the UI interface (Tools > Customization Tools).

Does anyone with experience in this area have a sample query or a specific method/check to distinguish between objects created directly in B1's UI and those created programmatically via the SDK?

Any shared knowledge or sample SQL queries would be greatly appreciated!

Thank you all very much!

entry.title: Service Layer no longer creates Draft / Approval for Documents (returns 201 instead of Draft)
entry.content:
Hello,

SAP Business One 10.0 version for SAP HANA (10.00.290) SP 2505 (64-bit) / Service Layer, we noticed a change in behavior when creating Sales Quotations via Service Layer.

Scenario

  • SAP Business One 10.0 (HANA)

  • Approval procedure active for Sales Quotations

  • Approval works correctly in SAP B1 client

Previous behavior
POST /b1s/v2/Quotations

  • Returned 404

  • Location header pointed to /Drafts(<DocEntry>)

  • Draft (ODRF) created and approval triggered

Current behavior

  • Returns 201 Created

  • Location points to /Quotations(<DocEntry>)

  • Final document is created

  • No draft / no approval triggered

Question

  • Is this a known change or limitation in newer Service Layer versions?

  • Is approval-based draft creation no longer supported via Service Layer?

  • Is creating drafts explicitly via /b1s/v2/Drafts now the only supported approach?

Any official confirmation or SAP Note reference would be appreciated.

Thank you.

entry.title: How to rename the label name on the relationship map?
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

We have an issue with confusing tile labels on the relationship map. Specificly with the same name for differenet types of labels.
There is an object named "return", but there are purchasing retuns and sales returns. In the German translation both of them have labels "Retoure". That is confusing (see the attached image). I tried to rename the labels and succeeded only halfway - the labes in menus have now different names. However on the relationship map the tiles appear further on with the same name.

Any idea how I can change the label names on the relationship map?

Any input will be highly appreciated.

entry.title: Will Removal of XSLT from the browser affect B1if ?
entry.content: Chrome decided to deprecate and remove XSLT from the browser on the near future ( Removing XSLT for a more secure browser  ). It looks like Firefox thinking the same way. Does these affect SAP Business One Integration Framework ?

entry.title: Period-End Closing (PEC) utility posting to Main Branch instead of individual branches - SAP B1
entry.content:
Hello experts,

We are using SAP Business One 10.0 SP 2505 with the Multiple Branches feature enabled. We are encountering an issue with how the Period-End Closing utility handles branch-specific balances.

The Issue

When running the Period-End Closing utility, we selected All Branches in the selection criteria. The system successfully generated the two standard Journal Entries:

  1. Closing Entry: P&L Accounts > Period-End Closing Account.

  2. Final Entry: Period-End Closing Account > Retained Earnings Account.

The Problem: Both Journal Entries were automatically assigned to the Main Branch.

The Impact on Reporting

  • Consolidated Trial Balance: Shows the correct zeroed-out balances for P&L accounts.

  • Individual Branch Trial Balance: When we run the TB for a specific sub-branch, the P&L accounts still show balances because the closing JEs were posted to the Main Branch instead of the sub-branch.

Questions for the Community

  1. Is it a requirement to run the Period-End Closing utility separately for each individual branch to ensure the JEs are tagged with the correct Branch ID?

  2. Is there a setting in G/L Account Determination or Branch Setup that allows a single PEC run to "split" the resulting JEs by branch automatically?

  3. If we must run it branch-by-branch, what is the best practice for the Retained Earnings account—should we have a separate RE account per branch, or is one central account standard?

Any advice on the standard workflow for multi-branch period-end closing would be very helpful.

entry.title: Purchase Order Budget Exceed Error in Approval Process
entry.content:
Hello,

We are trying to implement Purchase Order approval based on monthly budget addon in SAP Business One (SQL Server) using Approval Procedures.

The approval should trigger when:

  • PO exceeds monthly budget

  • Budget is based on Project + Cost Center +GL +Category)

    Query:

    SELECT
    CASE
    WHEN $[$39.2.12] >
    ISNULL(
    (
    SELECT
    CASE DATEPART(MONTH, $[$39.10.1])
    WHEN 1 THEN U_JanMon
    WHEN 2 THEN U_FebMon
    WHEN 3 THEN U_MarMon
    WHEN 4 THEN U_AprMon
    WHEN 5 THEN U_MayMon
    WHEN 6 THEN U_JunMon
    WHEN 7 THEN U_JulMon
    WHEN 8 THEN U_AugMon
    WHEN 9 THEN U_SepMon
    WHEN 10 THEN U_OctMon
    WHEN 11 THEN U_NovMon
    WHEN 12 THEN U_DecMon
    END
    FROM [@BUD1]
    WHERE DocEntry =
    (
    SELECT DocEntry
    FROM [@OBUD]
    WHERE U_PrjCode = $[$39.1.8]
    AND U_CostCenter = $[$39.1.9]
    )
    ),
    0)
    THEN 'TRUE'
    ELSE 'FALSE'
    END

    After saving this query in the Query Manager and assigning it in Approval Terms → Terms Based on User Queries, when I add a Purchase Order that exceeds the budget, the system throws the error:
    “Could not commit transaction: Error -1 detected during transaction '' (ECM5).”

    Budget Addon Screen:

entry.title: Item Cost of Finished Goods based on Purity of Raw Material
entry.content:
Dear Team,

We have encountered a business scenario where the cost of Finished Goods items is determined based on the purity of the Raw Material. However, in SAP Business One, the cost of the Raw Material is directly carried forward to the Finished Goods without considering purity.

This is causing a difference in gross profit at the item level in AR Invoice/Delivery.

Could you please confirm if there is any SAP standard solution available to handle this requirement?

Looking forward to your guidance.
